intro: Cassia kunthiana, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It is characterized by its long, drooping clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are rich in nectar and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds. Cassia kunthiana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in landscaping due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to different soil types.
